availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, physician. Claiborne County, Mississippi, native. Son of James Harvey Owen. Married to Sarah E. Hoagland Owen in Carroll County, Kentucky, on November 30, 1855. Father of Carrie Owen. Graduate of the University of Louisville in Louisville in 1844. Graduate of the University of Louisville Medical School in Louisville in 1849. Physician in Claiborne County, Mississippi, in 1850. Physician in Louisville, Kentucky, from 1858 through 1865. Owned three enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860. Employed Eliza Atchison and Mary Hansie as servants in Louisville in 1860.
